relatableEntityType.description: Type of the entity (deployment, environment, or resource)
relatableEntityType.name: relatableEntityType

apiKey.description: Datadog API key (supports Go templates for variable references)

appKey.description: Datadog Application key (supports Go templates for variable references)

site.description: Datadog site URL (e.g., datadoghq.com, datadoghq.eu, us3.datadoghq.com)

reference.description: Reference to the entity that this rule depends on

allowWindow.description: If true, deployments are only allowed during the window. If false, deployments are blocked during the window (deny window)

durationMinutes.description: Duration of each deployment window in minutes

rrule.description: RFC 5545 recurrence rule defining when deployment windows start (e.g., FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=MO,TU,WE,TH,FR;BYHOUR=9)

timezone.description: IANA timezone for the rrule (e.g., America/New_York). Defaults to UTC if not specified

maximumAgeHours.description: Maximum age of dependency deployment before blocking progression (prevents stale promotions)

minimumSockTimeMinutes.description: Minimum time to wait after the depends on environment is in a success state before the current environment can be deployed

rolloutType.description: Strategy for scheduling deployments to release targets. "linear": Each target is deployed at a fixed interval of timeScaleInterval seconds. "linear-normalized": Deployments are spaced evenly so that the last target is scheduled at or before timeScaleInterval seconds. See rolloutType algorithm documentation for details.

timeScaleInterval.description: Base time interval in seconds used to compute the delay between deployments to release targets.

metadata.description: Arbitrary metadata for the policy (record<string, string>)

createdBy.description: User ID who created this skip

environmentId.description: Environment this skip applies to. If null, applies to all environments.

expiresAt.description: When this skip expires. If null, skip never expires.

reason.description: Required reason for why this skip is needed (e.g., incident ticket, emergency situation)

resourceId.description: Resource this skip applies to. If null, applies to all resources (in the environment if specified, or globally).

ruleId.description: Rule ID this skip applies to

versionId.description: Deployment version this skip applies to

backoffSeconds.description: Minimum seconds to wait between retry attempts. If null, retries are allowed immediately after job completion.

backoffStrategy.description: Backoff strategy: "linear" uses constant backoffSeconds delay, "exponential" doubles the delay with each retry (backoffSeconds * 2^(attempt-1)).

maxBackoffSeconds.description: Maximum backoff time in seconds (cap for exponential backoff). If null, no maximum is enforced.

maxRetries.description: Maximum number of retries allowed. 0 means no retries (1 attempt total), 3 means up to 4 attempts (1 initial + 3 retries).

retryOnStatuses.description: Job statuses that count toward the retry limit. If null or empty, defaults to ["failure", "invalidIntegration", "invalidJobAgent"] for maxRetries > 0, or ["failure", "invalidIntegration", "invalidJobAgent", "successful"] for maxRetries = 0. Cancelled and skipped jobs never count by default (allows redeployment after cancellation). Example: ["failure", "cancelled"] will only count failed/cancelled jobs.

actionRequired.description: Whether the rule requires an action (e.g., approval, wait)

allowed.description: Whether the rule allows the deployment

details.description: Additional details about the rule evaluation

message.description: Human-readable explanation of the rule result

nextEvaluationTime.description: The time when this rule should be re-evaluated (e.g., when soak time will be complete, when gradual rollout schedule is due)

ruleId.description: The ID of the rule that was evaluated

satisfiedAt.description: The time when the rule requirement was satisfied (e.g., when approvals were met, soak time completed)

failureCondition.description: CEL expression to evaluate measurement failure (e.g., "result.statusCode == 500"), if not provided, a failure is just the opposite of the success condition

failureLimit.description: Stop after this many failures (0 = no limit)

successCondition.description: CEL expression to evaluate measurement success (e.g., "result.statusCode == 200")

successThreshold.description: Minimum number of consecutive successful measurements required to consider the metric successful

measurements.description: Individual verification measurements taken for this metric

intervalSeconds.description: Minimum time difference in seconds between the creation times of deployed versions. Only versions created at least this long after the currently deployed version will be allowed. This enables batching of frequent upstream releases into periodic deployments.

description.description: Human-readable description of what this version selector does. Example: "Only deploy v2.x versions to staging environments"

info.description: OpenAPI schemas for workspace engine protobuf messages
info.title: Workspace Engine API
